column4: hi! is there a way to repair an ubuntu installation without losing my documents (home directory)? i wasn't smart and i didn't put the home directory on a separate partition like i was supposed to
Almost definitely!
Be more specific.  What are you trying to do?
Do you NEED to reinstall?  What about the system isn't working?
You're just 1 step ahead of my questions! :)
So you'd rather try to reinstall than go through fixing the dependencies?  Do you have a live CD on hand?
The situation you're in is not hopeless.  I can help you get your system working again or I can help you reinstall without losing your data.  Which would you like to do?
wow thanks for all of the help
NP! :)
Thanks
Please start your posts with my name though so I see them easier.
well hold tight one sec while i try to repair the updating problem... if i can fix that, then i might be able to avoid reinstalling the entire system
right now it's running a partial update
Sure!  Go for the partial update and see what happens
212 package upgrades :o
That's gonna take a bit of time huh.  What did you do to get so far behind?  Were you messing with repos?
On the plus side it sounds like apt-get is in control.
HA HA HA
I'm gonna pretend you weren't serious about not upgradeing ;)
well i was also mesmerized by Windows 7 land for a few months
Windows Vista <= Windows 7 < Linux
